definition[0]: to keep someone away, or stop them doing something to you, by fighting or opposing them
example[0]: Bodyguards had to fight off the crowds.
example[1]: The company managed to fight off a takeover attempt.
definition[1]: to succeed in stopping other people getting something, and to get it for yourself
example[2]: Allan fought off stiff competition from throughout the UK to win one of only four places at the college.
definition[2]: to try hard to get rid of something, especially an illness or a feeling
